# Operational Amplifier Topologies
is a collection of jupyter notebook (.ipynb) that serve as a form of a blog that aims as a repository of knowledge of various Operational Amplifier Topologies (external hookup topologies such as filters, not internal OpAmp circuitry) from the basic Inverting and Non-Inverting to the more complex like sallen key filters and the Negative Impedance Converter (NIC)


The file that can be viewed on GitHub website and downloaded (information coming on how to) and used as an exploration tool is [OpAmpLearn.ipynb](https://github.com/PyLCARS/PySpiceExsamples/blob/master/Operational%20AmplifierTopologies/OpAmpLearn.ipynb). Where below are some the results of a Miller Capacitive Differentiator

Miller Capacitive Differentiator
<img src="https://github.com/PyLCARS/PySpiceExsamples/raw/69b562e6e7d6cc9707113a5832a5103dc7e3104c/Operational%20AmplifierTopologies/MillerCapDiff.png" width="300" height="300">

Bode Blots from Miller Capacitive Differentiator
<img src="data:image/png;base64,%0A">



The other files are the images of the topologies in the notebook from the source **draw.io** source file [OpAmpTobosDrawing.html](https://github.com/PyLCARS/PySpiceExsamples/blob/master/Operational%20AmplifierTopologies/OpAmpTobosDrawing.html). 

For my self, the initial author [Steven K Armour](https://www.linkedin.com/in/steven-armour-8a868547/) my goal is to iterate improvements to this work once a week. And in a long-term get more contributions from more engineers who also are passionate about cultivating and passing on the knowledge about circuit design.
